problem.markdown:
1. Nitrogen purging should be done:
(x) Before switching on the light source () After switching on the light source () Any time during the measurement () None of the above are correct
2. Reason for purging Nitrogen in the chamber of the CD spectrometer is:
() Nitrogen is an inert gas. (x) Oxygen present may be converted to ozone by far-UV light from the high intensity arc, and ozone will damage optical surfaces () Nitrogen Gas(N2)makes up 78.03% of the air. () None of the above are correct
3. Why it is essential to run a blank spectrum with buffer or solvent system before measuring the spectrum for sample:
(x) In order to check that the absorbance and High Tension voltage is not excessive. () To measure the absorbance of buffer. () Selection of good buffer. () All of the above are correct
4. Why the regulation of temperature of the cell holder is important:
() To prevent the optics from damage. (x) To keep the sample in homogenized state and avoid sample denaturation. () To maintain the temperature of the buffer or solvent used. () None of the above are correct.
5. How much time is required for the machine to warm up and achieve stability
() 1 min () 10 min () 15 min (x) 30 min
6. The optimum path length generally required for:
(x) Far UV CD spectra. () Near UV CD spectra. () None of the above are correct. () Both (A) and (B) are correct.

choicegroup.choice: Before switching on the light source
After switching on the light source
Any time during the measurement
None of the above are correct
